title: What Does Sent as Text Message Mean on iMessage?

steps.title: An SMS text is a regular text message.
steps.content: An SMS text is a regular text message. When you see Sent As Text Message , your iMessage has been sent from your end without issue, but it arrived at the recipient's device as a regular text . [2] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source With SMS texts, you won't be able to see if someone read your text . You'll only see Read Receipts for iMessages unless the recipient has them turned off. If you don’t want to send SMS messages, you can turn it off. Go to Settings → Messages → toggle off Send as SMS .

steps.title: iMessage is only available between iOS devices.
steps.content: iMessage is only available between iOS devices. When you message a non-iOS device, such as an Android, the blue text bubble turns green and it's sent as a regular text. It's possible the recipient switched from an iOS device to an Android (or other) device, so iMessage is no longer possible between your devices.

steps.title: iMessages are delivered over Wi-Fi.
steps.content: iMessages are delivered over Wi-Fi. If the recipient isn't connected to the internet, they may receive the iMessage as an SMS text message instead. You can try again later to see if it sends as an iMessage. [3] X Research source If your device isn’t connected to the internet, you may receive the iMessage Not Delivered notification underneath the message.

steps.title: If the recipient's device is off, you may see "Sent As Text Message".
steps.content: If the recipient's device is off, you may see "Sent As Text Message". The recipient could just need a simple recharge until they can receive iMessages again. Try to send your message again later when they've had a chance to power their device on again.

steps.title: iMessages sent as texts could mean you're blocked.
steps.content: iMessages sent as texts could mean you're blocked. While there's no way to be completely sure if someone blocked you on iMessage , having your messages consistently appear green with a known iOS user could be an indication.
